headline.main: Americans Trained for Jungle War With New Weapons, Garb, Tactics; Lessons of New Guinea and Guadalcanal Serve as Basis for Individual Combat Program -- Surprises in Store for Japanese

lead_paragraph: SOMEWHERE IN AUSTRALIA, June 2 -- The lessons of Buna and Guadalcanal emphasized for American military leaders in this area the importance of the individual soldier of the platoon and squad in the jungle-amphibious warfare that is demanded by conditions in the tropical Pacific.
abstract: Training of US troops, Australia, for jungle warfare described
